OFFICE OF
MAMIDIKUDURU11-6
:: 2 ::
You are my son. In return for the love I have for you, I have written this settlement deed and given it to you with the intention of providing you with some immovable property free of charge for the development of your well. As per the schedule below, the immovable property in Komarada village, which is my ancestral property and which I enjoy with full possession and rights, worth Rs. 5,79,000/- in literal terms, five lakhs and nine thousand rupees, is given to you free of charge and without consideration by writing this settlement deed. I have given possession of the said property to you on this very day. Therefore, from now on, you shall pay the government and panchayat taxes payable on the said property and enjoy it freely and comfortably with full possession, donation and sale rights for the entire period of the lunar calendar. I hereby certify that there are no encumbrances, pledges, agreements, mortgages, or other written or verbal acts of any kind whatsoever in respect of the property as per the Schedule, and that the property, survey number, permit, and boundaries are correct and that I hereby grant you this Settlement Deed in your name. This property is not an assignment land as per Section 9/77. Declaration
I undertake that if the property transferred by this deed does not contain any trees, plantations, precious minerals, mines, granites, machinery, fish ponds, etc., or if it is found that there is any such thing, I will be liable to prosecution and payment of depreciation duty as per law.

MAMIDIKUDURUSection 22-BRegistration Act - 1908
Declaration
This declaration is to inform that at the time of preparing this document, I have brought all the necessary documents such as the property details in the document, copies of the 1B bonds for the fields, tax receipts for the places/houses, details of the parties in the document, photographs of the parties, property details etc. and have examined all the elements completely and included them in this document and have prepared the document. No elements that should be written or included have been left out in this document. The schedule property has been physically examined and measured and the document has been drawn up. The said property is not for sale or mortgage to anyone except you. I/We declare that there has been no encroachment on the property, that the property is undisputed, that there are no dues payable on the property and that I/We will be able to pay the stamp duty as may be found in the future by the officers (Registration and Stamps Revenue Department) on the property in question. I/We have not violated the provisions of Section 22-B of the Registration Act, 1908 and I/We will be fully responsible for all other matters. Neither the Sub-Registrar nor the Registrar of Deeds has any connection with the property sold, and that it is not the Government, Endowment, Board of Trustees or any assignee that has been found in the future and that the investigation has been conducted. We are responsible for all such things. We have read this document completely and have given our full consent in writing. We have read and read the declaration - 4. Children - 7. Y. sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 249 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Yallamelli Balaveni in favour of her Son, Yallamelli Sivaganesh towards the property admeasuring an extent of 145.2 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 2-95, comprised in survey number 45, situated in Komarada Village & Grama Panchayai, Mamidikuduru Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Mamidikuduru, is bounded as follows:

North by: C.C. Road
South by: Site Of Mamidisetty Rajesh
East by: House Of Gogi Srinivasa Rao
West by: House Of Rapaka Raj
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
